medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant abdominal pain and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started last evening with severe chills and 1 bout of non-bloody, non-bilious emesis. Patient reports a similar episode last month with less severity. Pain was nearly constant and incapacitating earlier in the evening, relieved by morphine, and is not associated with food intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes mellitus, end-stage renal disease (ESRD) status post combined kidney and pancreas transplantation, osteoporosis, right eye blindness (from electrical injury), left eye with limited vision. Past surgical history includes combined kidney/pancreas transplantation and left toe amputation in the 1980s.
medical_history.social_history: Prior smoker (over a decade ago), occasional alcohol consumption, no intravenous drug abuse; lives at home and is independent with all activities of daily living.
